thread.title: Mets fans can take vintage train cars to watch NLCS vs. Cubs
thread.title_full: Mets fans can take vintage train cars to watch NLCS vs. Cubs

author: DAN RIVOLI
title: Mets fans can take vintage train cars to watch NLCS vs. Cubs
text:
Share this URL MTA The MTA is rolling out a vintage 11-car IRT 7 train, all built between 1948 to 1964, in honor of the Mets' games against the Chicago Cubs in the NLCS. It was dubbed "The Train of Many Colors" during its weekend run from Hudson Yards to Willets Point. 
Mets fans can take a trip back in time on vintage train cars that will run on the No. 7 line this weekend. 
The MTA is bringing out of retirement a colorful set of classic subway cars to carry hundreds of Mets fans to Citi Field where the Amazins will battle the Chicago Cubs for the National League championship. 
The "Train of Many Colors," made up of 11 cars built between 1948 and 1964, features trains painted deep red and a two-tone blue-and-cream model decked out in the colors of the World's Fair. 
The nostalgia train will roll out to Flushing Saturday and Sunday at 6:30 p.m. from the brand new 34 St-Hudson Yard station in Manhattan.
